statements.name: PROC HPEXPORT
statements.description: Begins an HPEXPORT procedure code block.
statements.help: PROC HPEXPORT ENV=environment-name<argument(s)> <PROJECT=project-name>USERSTAT mystat FUNC=myfunc DIST_TYPE= STANDARD | CONTRIB | WITHOUT;

arguments.name: ENV=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS Risk Dimensions environment that contains the project.

arguments.name: PROJECT=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the SAS Risk Dimensions project to be exported. If the argument is not specified, the HPEXPORT procedure exports all projects in the SAS Risk Dimensions environment. If the project-name does not exist in the environment, an error appears in the SAS log.

statements.name: CASEXPORT
statements.description: The CASEXPORT statement for the HPEXPORT procedure tells HPEXPORT to export the CAS risk Environment Table instead of the V9 Cube Descriptor.

arguments.name: ENVTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the CAS table to write the project and environment specifications. This is the CAS environment table.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a quoted string to serve as a label for the CAS risk environment. If unspecified, the label is blank.

arguments.name: METHODSTABLE=
arguments.description: specifies the CAS table to write the method, function, and subroutine specifications. This is the CAS method table. If unspecified, this table is not written.

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: specifies a name to associate with the CAS environment. If unspecified, the name is env-table.

arguments.name: PORTSOURCES=
arguments.description: specifies a portfolio input list, which is the result of the SOURCES statement in the RISK procedure. This contains position, counterparty, and mitigation data describing the portfolio.

statements.name: USERSTAT
statements.description: Enables you to register a user-defined statistic.
statements.help: USERSTAT mystat FUNC= myfunc DIST_TYPE= STANDARD | WITHOUT | CONTRIB | RAW <LABEL="label">;

arguments.name: mystat
arguments.description: specifies the name of the statistic to be registered.

arguments.name: FUNC=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the function from which the statistic is computed. Write this function in the COMPILE procedure and define it within the exported risk environment.

arguments.name: DIST_TYPE=
arguments.description: specifies the distribution from which the statistic is calculated, which determines what data is passed to the first argument of the function.

arguments.name: LABEL=
arguments.description: specifies a label for the user-defined statistic, which can be displayed in the SAS High-Performance Risk user interface.
